item.description: Iâ€™m a postdoctoral researcher and software developer in the Assembly & Algorithms (the A-Team) group, led by Bernardo Clavijo at the Earlham Institute in Norwich, England. I earned my PhD in Population Genetics from The University of East Anglia, where I was supervised by Professor Cock van Oosterhout. My research focused on the vital role recombination and hybridisation plays in the adaptive evolution of organisms to dynamic environments. I have studied Diatoms living in seasonally changing ocean regions, and rapidly adapting pathogens such as Oomycetes and Fungi.
